Safety and stability come from eliminating the threat at its roots. When you're out in the field, you don’t have the luxury of sentiment or hesitation. The enemy isn’t a people—they’re a blight. Every village, every person who supports them is part of the problem. You don’t negotiate with rot. You burn it out. 

I’ve seen what happens when you hold back. When you try to talk, to reason, to "protect" the innocent. The innocent die anyway. But this time, it’s different. We’ve learned. We don’t let them hide in the crowds. We don’t let them blend in. We take the fight to them, wherever they are. No mercy. No quarter. That’s the only way to make sure our people can sleep without fear.

I don’t think about them as people. They’re targets. Numbers. That’s how you stay sane. You don’t look at their faces. You don’t hear their voices. You just do what needs to be done. And if that means wiping them out entirely, then so be it. Our children deserve a future without the threat of their kind. That’s not cruelty—it’s survival.
